qa_pair.question: how easy is it to drain the oil?  and to clean the bucket?  is it fairly large or on the smaller end? thank you!
qa_pair.answer: Very easy. Exaclty as one would hope. The drain is controlled with a tap that swings one way to open, and the other way to close.I simply place a container in the sink, position the tap over it, and open. It's that simple. Cleaning is also a breeze. You simply remove the heating element, which makes for easy cleaning of the bowl, element and basket.

rewrite.edit: After that, place another bucket under the drain valve and spray clean water into the tank. Let the water drain out until you see clean water and then close the

This product is very easy to drain oil, the drain is controlled with a tap that swings one way to open, and the other way to close. The product is also very easy to clean, by removing the heating element.

qa_pair.question: how easy is it to drain the oil?  and to clean the bucket?  is it fairly large or on the smaller end? thank you!
qa_pair.answer: Draining was easy and is nice to be able to shut the valve off when the container we were draining in to was full. This is one of the larger deep fryers I have seen for kitchen use and basket holds a good amount as well. The basket is was easy to clean if you do it once you are done. If you let it set and cool down (overnight) after using a heavy batter could take you a bit to clean along with the heating element.  We are really happy with it and just ordered another one.

qa_pair.question: how easy is it to drain the oil?  and to clean the bucket?  is it fairly large or on the smaller end? thank you!
qa_pair.answer: It is very easy to drain. It is rather large. I put it near the edge of the counter and drain it into a funnel into an old orange juice carton. By far the best fryer we have ever had!

qa_pair.question: how easy is it to drain the oil?  and to clean the bucket?  is it fairly large or on the smaller end? thank you!
qa_pair.answer:
The deep fryer, in my opinion, is fairly large as far as deep fryers go.  It's very easy to clean the stainless steel "bucket."  After you drain the oil and take out the digital thermometer, you lift it out of the base.  So, it's very easy to clean.  I love that part about it.  To drain, it's not so bad.  Since it takes a lot of oil, I usually store the cooled oil in a large, used oil container.  While the fryer is on the counter, I gradually lower the oil container with a stainless steel funnel/strainer attached to it and put it on the floor as the fryer drains.  (I purchased the funnel as it was suggested when purchasing the fryer from Amazon.com)  The oil doesn't splash as it comes out.  It's a steady stream that comes out of a little "spicket" attached to the bucket.I hope I answered your questions.

qa_pair.question: how easy is it to drain the oil?  and to clean the bucket?  is it fairly large or on the smaller end? thank you!
qa_pair.answer: I use canola oil.  Its easy to drain.  You should have a funnel to catch the oil. qa_pair.question: General Question. What is the specific purpose of the Flash Bracket?
qa_pair.answer: Too get the light above eye level and avoid red eye, most pro photographers use a detachable light and hold the light at arms length above when flash photos are taken.  Then the lighting result looks more natural as light is coming from a slight angle...so bracket raises light some but higher is usually better.

rewrite.edit: The purpose of the Flash Bracket is to prevent red eye by positioning the light above eye level.  Professional photographers do this using a detachable light held at arms length from above. The result is more natural because the light is coming from a slight angle.  So the bracket achieves some of this.
The flash bracket is to get the light above the eye to prevent red eyes in pictures. A lot of people hold the light at arms length to take the picture.
The purpose of the Flash Bracket is for photos to look more natural as light is coming from a slight angle. A detachable light gets rid of red eye also.

qa_pair.question: General Question. What is the specific purpose of the Flash Bracket?
qa_pair.answer: Greetings, I would say that typically this bracket is used for holding and using a flash when the hot-shoe on your camera is being occupied by something else.  I use an Olympus E-PL1 with a VF-2 viewfinder, so my hot-shoe is being taken up by the viewfinder.  Using this bracket, I can use my VF2 and an External Flash, I've also found that the grip on the side (which is a sturdy foam) give a bit more control and less shake to my camera.  Their are multiple screw mount points on the bottom of the Bracket, I would imagine that it would fit most cameras.

qa_pair.question: General Question. What is the specific purpose of the Flash Bracket?
qa_pair.answer: It moves the light source higher at a more flattering angle to your subject.  This angle throws any shadow below the subject and in most cases out of site.  It also helps prevent red eye and blinking.  Another advantage is that it maintains a better point of light while slowing the camera to rotate from horizontal to vertical.  Hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: General Question. What is the specific purpose of the Flash Bracket?
qa_pair.answer: You can get a much better lighting angle of your flash than you would probably get from the top of your camera. You could also  turn the flash to sideways with the rotating bracket. Comes handy if you do not have walls or reflectors to bounce light. If you add a soft box for your flash, you would a much nicer tone especially if you are shooting people -- the pictures come out definitely better. The grip too lends a hand in handling your kit.

qa_pair.question: General Question. What is the specific purpose of the Flash Bracket?
qa_pair.answer: It gets the flash above the camera for different/better flash positioning and provides a handle for better camera control.  The bracket allows for reposition of the flash away from the top of the camera for different flash effects.

summary: This flash flip bracket will fit almost any SLR and flash with a standard hot shoe, including the Nikon D3100 with the Nikon SB 700 flash. An additional extension cord is needed to synchronize the flash with the camera. This bracket's structural pieces are made of metal and foam. The hot shoe is made of metal. To attach the external flash extension cord, insert one end into the camera and the other end into the cold shoe where the flash sits. The purpose of the Flash Bracket is to prevent red eye by positioning the light above eye level.  Professional photographers do this using a detachable light held at arms length from above. The result is more natural because the light is coming from a slight angle.  This bracket achieves this effect. The flash holder has a thumb screw located on the bottom to keep it attached to the bracket.

Best results appear to be freshly fallen dry leaves on very short grass.  Recommend mowing on lowest setting right before leaves start to fall.

qa_pair.question: Will it pick up acorns?
qa_pair.answer: Sort of  ,  sometimes .... The product is very cheaply made and the brushes are also cheaply made and there aren't really any adjustments. As you push the product you can raise or lower the bar as you walk but it is still too cheap and too weak to do much good. If your acorns are on the driveway or sidewalks then " Foget about it !" . qa_pair.question: Will it pick up acorns?
qa_pair.answer: No.  The bristles on the revolving brush aren't stiff enough to satisfactorily pick up the acorns.  You'll need something heavier duty.

summary: This product is suited for flat lawns with no bumps, otherwise most of what's picked up flies out the front. This product may not pick up sweet gum balls. This product does not have a debris/leaf guide, but has a small roller brush to pick up anything hung up in the roller brush. This sweeper may not pick up acorns or helicopter seed pods from maple trees. This product cannot handle matted leaves or leaves that have been rained on. One must rake them and then run the sweeper over them in order to lift some up. This product gets the best results with freshly fallen dry leaves. This product picks up a little bit of everything, including pine needles and grass that has been cut. This item will pick up larger items, but not artificial turf. This product will sometimes pick up acorns, but is cheaply made and doesn't have room for adjustments. Acorns that have recently fallen into short grass may be picked up if this product is used carefully.

qa_pair.question: could you drill the holes for an 8 inch center faucet?
qa_pair.answer: Possibly, but the soap trays on either side would be under it, so it won't be a perfectly clean instal.  You could caulk the gap and it would function though.

rewrite.edit: Possibly, but the soap trays on either side would be under it, so it won't be a perfectly clean instal. You could caulk the gap and it would function though.

A standard (non-air-gap) faucet, with or without tubing attached, needs a hole that's 7/16" in diameter or larger. You can install standard faucets comfortably in holes up to 1.25". It's possible to install in a 1.5" hole, but it's hard with the standard faucet escutcheon.

qa_pair.question: can i use it in cooking? is it food grade?
qa_pair.answer: DO NOT USE ESSENTIAL OILS FOR COOKING!!!!!essential oils are highly concentrated for aromatherapy, cosmetic, and medicinal use. they can not be used in place of culinary oils or extracts. If you are looking for food safe oils to use in recipeis please consider a brand like LorAnn specifically made for culinary use. If you were to try to replace a recognized culinary oil or extract (keep in mind extracts are not as concentrated as oils) with an essential oil you run the risk of making you or someone else sick at worst and making your food inedible at best.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: No, Typically when you install vinyl siding it is best to hand nail, because you are not supposed to set the nails completely tight. You should leave a little wiggle for the siding to move.

rewrite.edit: You should leave a little wiggle for the siding to move

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: I would say no..   This guns shoots normal (small) head nails and I typically use roofing nails for installing vinyl siding.   You also need to leave the nails loose so the vinyl siding can expand and contract.  I think it would be hard to leave the nails loose with any power nailer.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: I normally use my Roofing Nailer with a vinyl siding depth adjuster. My Bostitch roofing nailer R46N uses a Vinyl siding adapter rn46. This prevents over driving the nail in to deep which allows the siding room to expand and contract during seasonal temperature changes.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: I used this nailer to install Hardiplank siding.  Its too powrful for vinyl siding.  Personally, I wouldn't install vinyl siding on a storage building, much less a house.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: Now I have used this gun on fiber cement. I believe this product can be used on vinyl siding. I think the trick would be adjusting your air pressure on the gun. If I am not mistaken I think vinyl siding should be nailed to give it room to expand and contract. so if you dial the pressure in right I can't see why this product wouldn't work.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely! The nail heads are a bit small, but if you dial the regulated pressure on your compressor down to 50 psi or so, AND you drive the nails at an angle, they will consistently lay into the vinyl grooves with room for wiggle. (the head fits perfectly for nail placement) This speeds up putting up siding like nobody's business!

qa_pair.question: what is different between "DN" and "N" modles?
qa_pair.answer: DN (Duplex - both side printing & networking - ethernet)N (networking - ethernet)

qa_pair.question: what is different between "DN" and "N" modles?
qa_pair.answer: The N stands for network, which means it can connect through an Ethernet cable. The D stands for Duplex, which means it can print on both sides of a page automatically. So the N model connects through the network but cannot automatically print both sides of a page, while the DN connects through the network AND prints on both sides.

qa_pair.question: Is this water proof?
qa_pair.answer: I'm sure it's well resistant, but I wouldn't bet on PROOF without some additional epoxy covering.  You could give it a shot ... It's not an expensive test.  The water will likely interfere with the wireless signal if it is submerged, though.  Probably will make the device very hard to use, unless you're just talking about weather resistance for outdoor use.  As with all projects of that nature, try to give them a little protection from the brunt of the rain force, but they will handle the splash back without a problem.

qa_pair.question: Does the current draw go down as lights are dimmed or is the excess energy just dumped in the dimmer?
qa_pair.answer: It's really neither. The system works using Pulse Width Modulation (PWM - google it). Basically the LEDs are turned fully on and fully off fast enough that the eye can't see it.

rewrite.edit: Basically the LEDs are turned fully on and fully off fast enough that the eye can't see it.

Light dimmers save energy by reducing the flow of electricity to the bulb and allowing lights to operate with lower power outputs. Since lights under less stress shine longer, dimmers are known to extend the life span of your bulbs, too

 It's really neither. The system works using Pulse Width Modulation.

qa_pair.question: Does the current draw go down as lights are dimmed or is the excess energy just dumped in the dimmer?
qa_pair.answer: I'm not sure. There is a small device that is inline with the positive and negative 12v supply that regulates the voltage and can switch on and off power. I assume it is some sort of relay/potentiometer. I don't know where any excess power gets dumped, I think it's just not being used.

qa_pair.question: On this system there is a speaker set A and B.  Can you only power one set at a time or can you have both on for a surround set-up?
qa_pair.answer: You can connect two pairs of speakers and switch the pairs on or off individually.  BUT this is NOT "surround sound" or "Quadraphonic".  It's just two pairs of stereo speakers. qa_pair.question: Where is the source?
qa_pair.answer: From the bag:  "Long ago in what is now Central Utah, Native Americans found a mineral-rich salt deposit from an ancient sea when they saw deer eating the soil.  In 1959,Milo and Lamar Bosshardt were struggling to keep their family afloat when they discovered that this salt deposit extended beneath their land.  They began selling the salt to local farmers for their animals and heard reports the farmers were using the salt to season their own food.  People insisted this 'real' salt made available for everyday use and the brand was born"

qa_pair.question: how do you load the gun?

qa_pair.question: Does this product contain any dairy products and can it be used as a powder in bread recipes
qa_pair.answer: Sodium caseinate is the biochemical name for casein, which is a type of protein found in the milk from all mammals. Casein, which is Latin for "cheese," is a major component of commercial cheese and its principle source of protein. Casein is also used as a food additive and for industrial purposes. Some people are allergic to sodium caseinate, and it has been linked to some human diseases, mainly autism and gastrointestinal problems. Consult with an allergy specialist if you suspect an allergy or intolerance to any casein-based product.

qa_pair.question: What in the world is the difference is "wood" and "paint" sanding discs??
qa_pair.answer: Sandpaper is basically aluminum oxide particles glued on a substrate.  When removing paint, the areas between the sand particles can clog quickly rendering the paper unusable.  Certain manufacturers sell paper for "paint" sanding that is more resistant to clogging and theoretically should last longer. If your goal is to just sand bare wood, start with a course grit i.e.. 80 and then use progressively higher numbers until you get the desired smoothness.

qa_pair.question: Which seven great cities does the game use? Is there any educational benefit to learn any world history?
qa_pair.answer: The game uses the seven wonders of the ancient world: the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Mausoleum of Helicarnassus, the Colossus of Rhodes, the Statue of Zeus at Olympia, the Temple of Artemis at Ephesus, and the Lighthouse of Alexandria. There's not really any historical/educational benefit to the game other than the use of the 7 wonders and some historically flavored cards used in the game. It's a great game, but not educational.

rewrite.edit: This product includes the seven wonders of the ancient world: the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Mausoleum of Helicarnassus, the Colossus of Rhodes, the Statue of Zeus at Olympia, the Temple of Artemis at Ephesus, and the Lighthouse of Alexandria. Other than this and some historically flavored cards there is not much educational benefit to the game.

qa_pair.question: Which seven great cities does the game use? Is there any educational benefit to learn any world history?
qa_pair.answer: The game includes the Pyramids of Giza, Hanging Gardens of Babylon, Temple of Artemis at Ephesus, Statue of Zeus at Olympia, Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, Lighthouse at Alexandria, and the Colossus at Rhodes. Beyond that there is no real education value. It is a strategy game that uses a special feature from each wonder to help it achieve victory, but the special features are by and large arbitrary and really don't tell anything about the wonder itself. The artwork is good, though, and the game might instill curiosity to go and learn about the ancient wonders in some.

qa_pair.question: Which seven great cities does the game use? Is there any educational benefit to learn any world history?
qa_pair.answer: There is no educational benefit except for the names of real ancient cities (and their wonders and, with the Leaders expansion, the names of famous leaders from the past. Off the top of my head, some of the cities are the Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, The Lighthouse of Alexandria, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, and the Colossus of Rhodes. The expansions come with other wonders and cities beyond the original 7.

qa_pair.question: Which seven great cities does the game use? Is there any educational benefit to learn any world history?
qa_pair.answer: Other people mentioned the cities. While it does not teach specific history, it can open up a discussion regarding how one might build their city, concentrate on trade, or education, or war. You can use the rules of the game to associate how that might have worked in ancient times. I suppose, it's educational the way Monopoly can teach you the strategy of owning either a few expensive properties or many lower ones, and seeing which strategy wins out; and how you can relate that to real-life money-making strategies. I hope that makes sense. :)

qa_pair.question: Is this REALLY only a 30 min game?
qa_pair.answer: There's a pretty steep learning curve, but once everyone has the idea, the game goes very fast.  You don't have to wait for each individual to complete their turn... everyone can decide their turn at the same time, then resolve and move to the next round together.

qa_pair.question: Is this REALLY only a 30 min game?

qa_pair.question: Card sleeve size This game is getting a lot of play, especially the 3 - 5 player cards. It would be nice to sleeve them, does anyone know what size sleeves these need?
qa_pair.answer: The best sleeves are from Ultra Pro (http://amzn.com/B005CM80X0). The sleeves from Mayday Games are thinner, so they split easily if you try to shuffle the cards. Worse, the Mayday sleeves STICK to each other and you really have to double-check the cards when you sort them after a game. The Ultra Pro sleeves don't split and they don't stick. The only downside with the Ultra Pro sleeves is that they're a little bigger, so the cards don't easily fit in the storage slots in the box. They DO fit, but it's tight.

rewrite.edit: The best sleeves for this product are made by Ultra Pro (http://amzn.com/B005CM80X0). These Ultra Pro sleeves don't split and they don't stick  likes the ones from Mayday Games. The downside to the Ultra Pro is that the cards don't fit perfectly and it can be a bit tight.

qa_pair.question: Do the heating elements move to adjust for different bread thicknesses?
qa_pair.answer: the heating elements remain on the 2 inside and outside walls. the metal (i will call baskets) close in on whatever your bread thickness is as soon as it starts to lower. i have put really thick bagels in it and it did well.

the heating elements remain on the 2 inside and outside walls. starts to lower. i have put really thick bagels in it and it did well.
The heating elements remain on the 2 inside and outside walls. The metal closes in on whatever bread thickness you pick.

qa_pair.question: Do the heating elements move to adjust for different bread thicknesses?
qa_pair.answer: I agree that the slots are big enough for sliced bagels, not a whole bagel.  The heating elements themselves do not move closer to the bread/bagels, there are so-called 'clamps' that once the bread is lowered into the toaster, it will close/lock in the bread, from both sides to hold the bread in the middle of the heating elements so that the bread does not lean to one side or the other.  It then releases when toasting is complete and rises to the top.  Personally I think this helps to toast evenly on both sides.

qa_pair.question: Do the heating elements move to adjust for different bread thicknesses?
qa_pair.answer: The actual heating elements don't move but the racks that hold the bread in place adjust based on thickness of the bread.

qa_pair.answer: The heating elements do not move but the bread holders do to hold each thickness perfectly.

qa_pair.question: Do the heating elements move to adjust for different bread thicknesses?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, they adjust within limits. Half bagels are no problem and the unit toasts perfectly. The add more time feature really helps if you want the bread or bagel toasted more. Also the setting for toasting is very accurate and it will toast the same way every time. We love ours!

qa_pair.question: Do the heating elements move to adjust for different bread thicknesses?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it does. This is a great toaster.

summary: This toaster is 7 1/2" high, 10" long, and 6 3/4" wide. The slots are 5 1/2 long by 1/12 inches and it will be able to handle slices of bread thicker than a bagel. Bread toasts in less than 3 minutes on the medium setting but that depends on the level of darkness but it's pretty quick.  It also has a feature that lets you check the progress. The heating elements remain on the 2 inside and outside walls. The metal closes in on whatever bread thickness you pick. You can't turn the beep off but it's just one beep. The beep can be muted on more recent versions of the BTA820XL and BTA840XL and it can be muted from low to high. After 7 months of light use, the toasters elements will be burned. If you return the product they will send you a new one without charge.

qa_pair.question: Is the motor reversible?
qa_pair.answer: Yes. the motor is reversible. Reversal of lines 5 and 8 result in direction of motor rotation. Line 5 is the black wire and Line 8 is the red. You can also change it to run on 220 (single phase) from the delivered configuration of 110V.

qa_pair.question: Are the handles and knobs, plastic or metal?
qa_pair.answer: The one adjusting knob is a molded synthetic of some sort, possibly a phenolic resin, with a threaded stud that screws into a metal lock collar. It is pretty tough and not what I'd consider a "normal" plastic part, it's the same material commonly seen on other power tools. Switching to a 1/4"x20 hex head bolt or metal thumbscrew is all it would take if you want to replace it, but it's not really necessary.

qa_pair.question: Are the handles and knobs, plastic or metal?

qa_pair.question: Is it 120 volt?
qa_pair.answer: Over the course of many years the designation for single phase AC household voltage has been commonly stated as either 110, 115 and 120... it's all pretty much interchangeable when used in product descriptions. So to answer your question... Yes, the dual voltage Baldor motor comes setup to run on all of the above mentioned voltages.

This product is 20" wide and 20 "deep, but there is an extra 4" on the back for the faucet, soap, drain plug, etc. The plastic is about 1/2" thick and is a 1 piece thermoplastic leak-proof tub with a 19 gallon capacity. There are three holes and 4 on the center which make this a laundry sink. On the top ledge the faucet goes there with a "soap" holder on each side of the faucet. As far as the unit itself, there is no reason it can't be used outside. The legs are not very strong but depending on where in the U.S. you live, there shouldn't be a problem.

qa_pair.answer: I use mine to make home made tonic water.  It has citric acid and the zest of one lemon, one lime and one orange.  And the bottle has held up quite well.  I see no reason lemon juice would be different.  Just make sure to add after carbonation process.

summary: One 1 Liter bottle of fizzy water has one CO2 cartridge. The 1 Liter bottle contains an airtight cap so the soda remains as in a siphon and retains the gas but it is best to consume it within 24 hours. This item does not fit the SodaStream 1 Liter bottles although its contents can be poured into the SodaStream bottles. If this product is compared to the Soda Stream Fountain Jet Home Soda Maker Starter Kit, it comes out much less expensive and also smaller. It is cost-efficient to throw this product out and buy brand new ones which are not true of the Soda Stream. They last forever and cost just pennies per liter. All kinds of flavored syrups like natural lemon juice can be added to the bottle to make sodas. Anything that can have bubbles blown through it works just fine. Some liquids cannot be fully carbonated. As shown on youtube, juices are too thick unless they are watered down and wines do work, but only about half a bottle because of all the fizz it creates. They are not recommended for these reasons. Each CO2 cartridge lasts for one bottle. One hundred cartridges sell for about $35.

I wouldn't expect this to be satisfactory for clearing things off lawns.  t use the 24 volt version.  Higher voltage may give you more power.  I just didn't need that.

qa_pair.question: rate this blower from 1 to 10 to clean on grass,thanks
qa_pair.answer: Part of it depends on how high the grass is.  If the leaves are stuck in the grass, it takes the right angle of the blower to make them move.  If the leaves are sitting on top of the grass, I'd say about 8.  Part of it also depends on how heavy the leaves are (if they're wet.)  That's the hardest to make them move, and then it'd be about a 5.

qa_pair.question: straight talk now has sims cards for unlocked cell phones. will this cell phone work with straight talk?
qa_pair.answer: I have 2 of these phone for use in a dual sim configuration, one for controlled cost from the US and the other from the country that we are traveling. All that you have to do is check the GSM  frequency from your carrier with those of the phone. This may be a quad band phone which should work in the majority of the covered world. The dual stand-by function works flawlessly. One sim slot allows 3G data speeds while the other allows only 2G. It's a typical Android environment.  Overall it's a good phone that we will use for the foreseeable future with no need to change.

qa_pair.question: straight talk now has sims cards for unlocked cell phones. will this cell phone work with straight talk?
qa_pair.answer: Yes Vivo 4.3 works with StaightTalk.  It uses a mini-SIM which is currently the only one that StraightTalk has.  StraightTalk SIMs at this point only use the T-mobile network. The used to allow you to choose from AT&T; or T-mobile but AT&T; has started their own prepaid service called Aio and so they are not letting StaightTalk start any new customers with their service.  I have used the Vivo 4.3 on StraightTalk, AT&T;, T-mobile, and multiple vendors in Europe(O2, Three(3) mobile, EE, etc.) so you can count on it to work wherever you go.

qa_pair.question: will it fit craftsman table saw model #315.228310
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it should. The Hitachi mitre gauge here is 3/4" wide by 3/8" tall, which is standard groove size for many table saws. This gauge fit my Craftsman saw fine. Newer table saws have an extra edge cut at the base of the mitre slots, and this mitre gauge has a round retaining disk that fits into this slot. I don't know if your saw has this extra retaining edge (mine did not), but if not the disk on the gauge is easily removable.

qa_pair.question: How is the "smell factor" without a filter?
qa_pair.answer: If you empty every day and only compost plant matter, smell is not a factor. If you can't, like in winter with deep snow, a week or more into it you HAVE to empty it. No so much for smell but for MOLD! In Spring and Summer, the problem is kitchen ants. Necessitating regular emptying into your garden bin or municipal barrel.

qa_pair.question: Can you use a bag in it?
qa_pair.answer: I use a 2.6 gallon compostable Glad bag, which is their smallest; there is about a 5 inch overhang, but it works. The interior of the bin is perfectly smooth and lid is easy to remove for cleaning. I find that there is a small amount of leakage after a week of filling the bin--either the bags are semi-permeable or they are beginning to compost. I take the bin out to my compost heap and dump the bag and liquid, then I rinse and dry the bin. A small inconvenience.

qa_pair.question: How can you say its a quad bander without AM or SSB on 10 Meters? FM is a Euro mode only.
qa_pair.answer: You are thinking of 11 meters (CB) with AM and SSB. Additionally, the European FM mode for CB that you are refering to is PMR446 (446 MHz; which happens to be on the 70 cm HAM band in the US and Canada), with a max of 500 mW. If you mistakenly thought of European PMR446, instead of the UK CB band on 27 MHz (not the US system of frequencies) using FM, they are regulated to roughly 500 mW output.The TYT TH-9800 radio operates on 10 meters (HAM) in FM mode, along with three other HAM bands (6 meters, 2 meters, and 70 centimeters). It is a quad-band radio.

rewrite.edit: You're thinking of 11 meters with AM and SSB. The European FM mode for CB is PMR446 and has a max of 500 mW. This is a quad band radio.

The radio is quad-band of 11 meters (CB) with AM and SSB. The CB European FM mode is PMR446 (70 cm HAM band for Canada and US frequencies), and max of 500 MW. In FM mode, operates in 10m HAM, and three extra Ham bands (6 meters, 2 meters, and 70 centimeters).

Note that 10m almost qualifies as a VHF band, coming in just shy of the 30 MHz limit. ... There are three VHF bands: 6 m (50 to 54 MHz), 2 m (144 to 148 MHz) and 1.25 m (222 to 225 MHz). The UHF range includes the 70 cm (420 to 450 MHz), 33 cm (902 to 928 MHz), 23 cm (1240 to 1300 MHz) and 13 cm (2300 to 2450 MHz) bands.

qa_pair.question: How can you say its a quad bander without AM or SSB on 10 Meters? FM is a Euro mode only.
qa_pair.answer: FM is allowed on 10 meters in the US ham band from 29.52Mhz to 29.6Mhz

In FM mode, it operates in 10m HAM, and has extra Ham bands (6 meters, 2 meters, and 70 centimeters).

qa_pair.question: can this cable be used from laptop to tv or galaxy S4 to to tv
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it can be used for laptop to TV. To go from your Galaxy S4 to TV, you will need an MHL adapter. The MHL adapter goes in the micro USB on your phone, then you can connect the HDMI cable to the MHL adapter, and the other end to your TV.

qa_pair.question: can this cable be used from laptop to tv or galaxy S4 to to tv
qa_pair.answer: It just depends on what kind of jack you have. Many laptops these days come standard with HDMI jacks. In that case, you can just easily plug in this cable and the screen will pop up on your TV. Easy as that. If the laptop has some other monitor connection such as DVI, then you would need a separate HDMI adapter to use this cable. As for the S4, you will definitely need an HDMI adapter to use these cables with it. Samsung makes one that you can buy separately, but I'm sure there are plenty of knock offs out there. Hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: How is the ventilation with the door closed? Is there a way to get air through with it safely zipped?
qa_pair.answer: You may not have looked at inexpensive tents lately.  They are mesh under the fly these days.  They in reality are three season tents.

rewrite.edit: The inexpensive tents are mesh under the fly. They are basically 3 season tents now.
Tents these days have mesh under the fly for ventilation. They in reality are three season tents.
The ventilation is mesh. Air can safely get through while zipped.

qa_pair.question: How is the ventilation with the door closed? Is there a way to get air through with it safely zipped?
qa_pair.answer: There's no way *not* to get air in this tent.   Two of the four walls are mostly mesh, with a rainfly stretched over the top.  This tent is designed for warm or hot weather, and will not seal up tight to keep out the cold.  In my experience with two adults on a moderately cool night (mid 40s), this tent retained almost no heat inside.

qa_pair.question: How is the ventilation with the door closed? Is there a way to get air through with it safely zipped?
qa_pair.answer: These have good ventilation. Good for warm climates. The two sides are screen, but the fly keeps the rain out (and provides privacy).

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?
qa_pair.answer: To avoid weakening the tent fabric along fold lines used over and over, you should just stuff the tent into the stuff sack; never store a tent rolled up; ideally store the completely dry tent in a slightly larger stuff sack that allows a little air flow to avoid fabric compression and reduces the chance of mildew developing.

rewrite.edit: Stuff the tent into the stuff sack to avoid weakening the tent fabric along the fold lines. Never store a tent rolled up, instead store the dry tent in a larger stuff sack that allows some air flow to reduce mildew development.
Don't fold over tent fabric because it could weaken so just stuff into stuff sack that is dry to allow very little air flow to prevent mildew.
You can stuff the tent into the stuff sack but do not store it while rolled up. Ideally it should be completely dry and allows little airflow to avoid fabric compression and mildew.

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?
qa_pair.answer: I didn't have much problem getting it back into the bag.  Lay it out flat.  Then get the storage bag and lay it next to the tent so you can see the size it needs to be when folded.  Fold both sides of the tent in toward the middle until the width of the tent is a little less than the length of the storage bag.  Then roll it up very tight and it should fit into the bag.

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?
qa_pair.answer: you can sort of see the fold lines when it is laying flat.  You should leave the door open so extra air can escape and then make sure at the end you fold in the top piece and poles.  I am not 100% certain, but I seem to recall you start off folding the tent in 1/2 and then 1/3rds....Good luck!!

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?
qa_pair.answer: PUSH IT! :-) Seriously, fold it as much as you can on the lines that remains from the first time you took it out and then the rest is just pushing it harder and harder! That is how I do it :-)

qa_pair.question: How do you fit 6 people in this tent? 10x10 is less than 2ft./person.
qa_pair.answer: Person ratings on tents are always horribly optimistic.  They're basically how many people you can theoretically fit if they're all average sized and packed in like sardines.  Yeah, you can fit 6 people in but they won't be moving around at all and will be packed edge to edge.  Realistically 4 is probably the most you'd want in any "6 person" tent.  I tend to just subtract 2 from any published capacity on a tent automatically.

qa_pair.question: need to install on cadillac excalade 2005, just says plug into fuse box?
qa_pair.answer: On my 2005 Silverado, the connector box is under the left side of steering wheel and against the firewall (between brake pad and emergency brake lever).  I cannot say for sure that the Excalade is identical.  It has a plastic screw in center and push connectors on the sides of the cover.  With cover removed, the plugin just plugs to the top row of connectors second from the left.  Then just tuck the wiring out of the way under the dash (plastic electrical ties) and mount the brake controller on the bottom of the dash with provided bracket.  Done.

qa_pair.answer: Don't purchase the controller + the wiring harness for the 03-06 Silverado as the Plug and Play wiring is specific for these model year Chevy Silverados. The Tekonsha P3 will work with the 2010 Silverado, just need to wire it in instead of plug and play as on earlier year Chevys.

qa_pair.question: Can the power box be converted to the RV's 12 volt power system?
qa_pair.answer: We just direct wired it into the 12 volt system and eliminated the power box converter. Just cut the wire off the box and direct wired it into a FUSED CONNECTION. Make sure you fuse protect it. Try 10-15 amps if that doesn't hold then go to 20 amps. Mine works just fine. Powers right up and finds the birds in less than 3-4 minutes. Much better that that Tailgater mess

qa_pair.question: Can the power box be converted to the RV's 12 volt power system?
qa_pair.answer: I would think that you could splice the wire, but the cord and power adaptor (supplied) is so convenient if you have a 110v rec. nearby.  You will need a rec. to supply your reciever and you will be able to turn your power off once it locks in to sats. installation was easy if you are somewhat mechanical.

qa_pair.question: Can the power box be converted to the RV's 12 volt power system?
qa_pair.answer: The system (and control box) uses 48 VDC so that's not an easy conversion to make from 12 volts. A small inverter would probably be a better solution since the antenna only needs power when raising and stowing.

However, if you want to use the camera while the front cover is folded tight to the back cover, you cannot use the camera, since the FRONT cover will cover the camera lens.  When taking a picture in Portrait mode, I keep the front cover at a 90 degree angle to help keep the iPad steady.  When taking a picture in Landscape mode, I just let the cover hang to the bottom.  P.S.  I love this case because of the solid protection, the nice "grip" when holding the case, and the many standing positions provided.  Good Luck!  Christine

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: Outdoor survival yes. Urban survival kind of. This tool, in my opinion, is a outstanding survival tool for woodland survival. qa_pair.question: will this work on the celestron nexstar 130 gt
qa_pair.answer: It will work on the NexStar 130 GT but mainly for the Moon. The focal length is 650mm so Jupiter and other planets will be small. You can use a 2x to 3x Barlow though to double or triple your focal length. Then the main issue becomes how well does the scope track. With the small field of view that you get with this camera it is hard to find and keep the planet in sight. You can ask your question at Cloudy Nights and get many more people trying to help you.

qa_pair.question: will this work on the celestron nexstar 130 gt
qa_pair.answer:
Kevin K. asks if the Celestron NexImage 5 MP "will [...] work on the Celestron Nexstar 130 GT".The answer is yes and no.  On the one hand, the camera's machined aluminum 1.25" adapter barrel will fit almost any telescope.  It will fit the Celestron Nexstar 130 GT without the additional expense of a particular adapter.  Other the other hand, the camera gives its best results on a fully-guided scope.  While the Celestron Nexstar 130 GT can slew to an object it does not have the fine tracking abilities of the CGEM DX or CGEM pro mounts.  So while the camera will fit and while it will produce images, its use on the Celestron Nexstar 130 GT will preclude long exposures.  In other words, with the Celestron Nexstar 130 GT, the camera would be best used for astrophotography of the moon, of the big planets (Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Venus), of the occasional bright comet and of the sun WITH THE APPROPRIATE SOLAR FILTER.  It will be difficult to image faint objects on the Celestron Nexstar 130 GT, not because of the OTA but because of the mount.

qa_pair.question: will this work on the celestron nexstar 130 gt
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely, but you will probably need to use a 2x or 3x barlow to get the planets large enough. (3 x 650mm = 1950m)   Images of Jupiter look the best at near 2000mm. I recommend Televue Powermates for best performance.

qa_pair.question: Anyone use this on a Celestron spotting scope?  What were your results?
qa_pair.answer: The bigger the scope the better. Once you get the optimal focal ratio (f/11 for this camera) your image of Jupiter will be, in pixels, about the size of your scope, in mm. An 8" scope (200mm) will give you a Jupiter around 200 pixels wide. Watch my YouTube video Planetary Imaging - Which Barlow? to see how I came up with that. A spotting scope has a small lens. Also, you need to have a motorized mount that will take out the Earth's rotation. See my video Planetary Imaging - Equipment Needed to learn more.

qa_pair.question: will work with NexStar 130 SLT Computerized Telescope? Will need any adaptor (or advised to have?) thanks
qa_pair.answer: The Solar system Imager needs a 1.25 inch focusser. I'm using it with a Nextar 6SE telescope.  The only other restriction would be if the focusser wouldn't let the device go deep enough to come to focus.  I tried to use it with a homebuilt 10 inch Newtonian that I'm going to need to modify.  That's not something you would want to do with the 130.  Since yours is a Newtonian, it MAY have that problem.

qa_pair.question: will work with NexStar 130 SLT Computerized Telescope? Will need any adaptor (or advised to have?) thanks

qa_pair.question: will work with NexStar 130 SLT Computerized Telescope? Will need any adaptor (or advised to have?) thanks
qa_pair.answer: The NexStar 130 SLT uses a 2" eyepiece so you would need an adapter as the camera is made for 1.25" eyepiece. You will also need a Windows or Mac computer as well of course.

summary: This product will work with any telescope with a 1.25" eyepiece but you would be required to refocus and re-center the object with the eyepiece. This product can work with the NexStar 130 for viewing of the Moon. It would be hard to see other planets unless you change the focal length. This product is for use with a Windows system. A Mac would need a different product than this one for ideal use. This product is threaded on both ends so that you can put them on both ends with a 1.25" adapter compatible with any telescope that you would like to use them on. This product would work with a Windows 7 but wouldn't work with Linux. This product can be used ideally with a large telescope but with a smaller optic you would have a lot of feedback that would interfere with results. This product can be used with 2x or 3x to get higher magnification but it would be more difficult to keep centered and in focus unless you are very skilled. This product comes standard with a 1.25" barrel that can be used with any 1.25" eyepiece, which includes the Nexstar130 SLT without an adapter.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this while driving?
qa_pair.answer: Yes you can if you are careful not to put too much physical pressure on the unit.  Once it is in place and operating at your desired level of intensity, then driving with it is no problem.  If you lean back in the driver's seat or otherwise add pressure to your back, thereby increasing the intensity, then you need to consider setting a less intense level of activity on your unit.  It only runs for 30 minutes so shouldn't be a problem.
